intro: Ancistrocarpus bequaertii, commonly known as the New Caledonian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has woody stems and broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
